resources.string: An activity is usually a single screen that the user sees on the device at one time?
The Activity Manager is responsible for creating, destroying, and managing activities?
When an activity doesn’t exist in memory, it is in a starting state?
Only one activity on a device can be in a running state?
When an activity is not in focus but still visible on the screen, we say it’s in a paused state?
When an activity is not visible, but still in memory, we say it’s in a stopped state?
A destroyed activity is no longer in memory?
The fact that an activity is in a running state doesn’t mean it’s doing much?
There are currently two ways to create activity user interfaces: the standard and older activity views and the newer fragments?
Intents are messages that are sent among the major building blocks?
An intent could be explicit or implicit?
Services run in the background and don’t have any user interface components?
Content providers are interfaces for sharing data between applications?
Broadcast receivers are Android’s implementation of a system-wide?
Broadcast receivers themselves do not have any visual representation?
